item.title: The Tombs of Atuan
item.description: The funny thing is, I sometimes resist reading Ursula K. Le Guin. Because I know I’ll have to stop, and do nothing else, and absorb through my pores, and not read any of the other ten or twelve things I might have read that week, and just camp out in her world as long as I can.

item.title: Among Others
item.description: “[[notes/bibliotropic|Bibliotropic]],” Hugh said. “Like sunflowers are heliotropic, they naturally turn towards the sun. We naturally turn towards the bookshop.”

item.title: Reputation
item.description: Lex Croucher’s lols-per-page cannot be beat. Weirdly, the only character I was meh on was the love interest, just because he’s too perfect.
